topic.title: Dynamic Open File in Distributed via JavaWebStart

section.title: Question
section.p: How can we dynamically open a file in an distributed via JWS?

section.title: Answer
section.p: The JWS packager ANT build file which comes with signs by default the JNLP file (this means that a copy of it is included in the main JAR library) in this step: <copy file="${outputDir}/${packageName}/${productName}.jnlp" tofile="${home}/JNLP-INF/APPLICATION.JNLP"/> Signing the JNLP file indeed means that it is impossible to automatically generate a JNLP file containing some dynamic arguments.

But the JNLP does not need to be signed. Indeed the user probably receives this information when launching the application but at least in this way you should be able to dynamically generate a JNLP file via a PHP script based on the URL which was clicked by the user.
The generated JNLP would then take as argument the URL which needs to be opened when starts.

Maybe a different approach (more complicated though) would be to have the JNLP file signed and always refer as a URL argument a location like this: http://path/to/server/redirectEditedURL.phpWhen the URL gets clicked on the client side you would also call a PHP script on the server side which would update the redirect location for redirectEditedURL.php to point to the clicked XML resource. Then the opened would try to connect to the redirect PHP and be redirected to open the XML.
